s0041: The Guangling man Zhao Ping then served Chen Wang by attacking Guangling, but could not take it.
s0042: He heard Chen Wang had been defeated and fled, and Qin troops were about to arrive, so crossed the Yangtze, forged Chen Wang's order, appointed Liang as Chu King's 'Supreme Pillar of State'.
s0043: He said: 'Jiangdong is already pacified, urgently lead troops west to attack Qin.'
s0044: Xiang Liang then led eight thousand men across the Yangtze west.
s0045: He heard Chen Ying had taken Dongyang, sent messengers desiring to join forces and go west together.
s0046: Chen Ying was formerly a Dongyang county clerk, resided in the county, was always trustworthy and careful, called an elder.

s0050: Chen Ying's mother said to Ying: 'Since I became your family's wife, I have never heard that your ancestors had nobles.
s0051: Now suddenly gaining great fame, it is not auspicious.
s0052: Do not accept the king title.'
s0053: Ying's strategist Qin Jia said: 'If you do not accept, the people will disperse.
s0054: If you accept, you will gain great merit.'

s0056: Xiang Liang sent messengers to Chen Ying, wishing to join forces.
s0057: Chen Ying's mother said: 'I heard generals are like women's husbands, difficult to know.

s0060: Chen Ying sent messengers to Xiang Liang saying: 'My mother said generals are difficult to know.

s0062: Xiang Liang was angry, attacked Chen Ying, defeated him.
s0063: Chen Ying fled to Dongyang, Xiang Liang pursued and killed him.
s0064: Xiang Liang took Dongyang, incorporated Chen Ying's troops, his forces grew to twenty thousand.
s0065: Xiang Liang then led troops west, camped at Xiapi.

s0067: Xiang Liang sent messengers to Liu Ji, wishing to join forces.

s0073: Liu Ji followed his plan, invited Xiang Liang to a banquet, killed him.
s0074: Xiang Liang's death caused the army to lose heart.
s0075: Xiang Ji heard of Xiang Liang's death, led troops east to Pengcheng.
s0076: He attacked Liu Ji at Xiapi, defeated him.
s0077: Liu Ji fled to Sui, Xiang Ji pursued and killed him.
s0078: Xiang Ji then gathered the Chu troops, established himself as general.
s0079: He sent Fan Zeng to Pengcheng to welcome King Huai.
